segment.source: Determine Your Publishing Method
segment.target: Determine Your Publishing Method

segment.source: Determine Your Publishing Method
segment.target: Determine Your Publishing Method

segment.source: Determine Your Publishing Method
segment.target: Determine Your Publishing Method

segment.source: After you sequence an application by using the Application Virtualization Sequencer, you need to publish that application to your users.
segment.target: After you sequence an application by using the Application Virtualization Sequencer, you need to publish that application to your users.

segment.source: Publishing the application consists of delivering the icons, package definition information, and content source location to each computer where the Application Virtualization Client has been installed.
segment.target: Publishing the application consists of delivering the icons, package definition information, and content source location to each computer where the Application Virtualization Client has been installed.

segment.source: The following table describes publishing methods that are supported when you deploy Application Virtualization by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system.
segment.target: The following table describes publishing methods that are supported when you deploy Application Virtualization by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Advantages
segment.target: Advantages

segment.source: Disadvantages
segment.target: Disadvantages

segment.source: Generate a Windows Installer file during sequencing, as a stand-alone solution.
segment.target: Generate a Windows Installer file during sequencing, as a stand-alone solution.

segment.source: Very simple to use.
segment.target: Very simple to use.

segment.source: Package loaded into cache locally on each computer.
segment.target: Package loaded into cache locally on each computer.

segment.source: Icons displayed to user.
segment.target: Icons displayed to user.

segment.source: Similar to traditional software deployment.
segment.target: Similar to traditional software deployment.

segment.source: No need for streaming servers.
segment.target: No need for streaming servers.

segment.source: No flexibility in location of package contents on computers—same location on all computers.
segment.target: No flexibility in location of package contents on computers—same location on all computers.

segment.source: Must use only Add/Remove Programs or msiexec to remove applications.
segment.target: Must use only Add/Remove Programs or msiexec to remove applications.

segment.source: Removal and replacement with new version required for package updating.
segment.target: Removal and replacement with new version required for package updating.

segment.source: Generate a Windows Installer file during sequencing, used with MODE, LOAD, and OVERRIDEURL command-line properties and the package manifest.
segment.target: Generate a Windows Installer file during sequencing, used with MODE, LOAD, and OVERRIDEURL command-line properties and the package manifest.

segment.source: Simple to use but with added flexibility.
segment.target: Simple to use but with added flexibility.

segment.source: Icons displayed to user.
segment.target: Icons displayed to user.

segment.source: SFT file containing the applications can be placed on a streaming source location, with clients configured to use that location.
segment.target: SFT file containing the applications can be placed on a streaming source location, with clients configured to use that location.

segment.source: Limited flexibility—only the location of the package content can be controlled at run time.
segment.target: Limited flexibility—only the location of the package content can be controlled at run time.

segment.source: Must use only Add/Remove Programs or msiexec to remove the application.
segment.target: Must use only Add/Remove Programs or msiexec to remove the application.

segment.source: Removal and replacement with new version required for package updating, unless using streaming server.
segment.target: Removal and replacement with new version required for package updating, unless using streaming server.

segment.source: Run SFTMIME commands.
segment.target: Run SFTMIME commands.

segment.source: Complete flexibility—full control of all package management functions.
segment.target: Complete flexibility—full control of all package management functions.

segment.source: Commands must be scripted for use with the ESD system.
segment.target: Commands must be scripted for use with the ESD system.

segment.source: Commands must be run on each computer in correct sequence.
segment.target: Commands must be run on each computer in correct sequence.

segment.source: Detailed understanding of command language and careful planning required.
segment.target: Detailed understanding of command language and careful planning required.

segment.source: For more information about using these publishing methods, see How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client.
segment.target: For more information about using these publishing methods, see How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client.
